location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter D from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, on the Honourable Company's Sloop of War Cliveat Muscat to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Hennell reports on his arrival at Muscat, and his meeting with Sheikh Saeed ben Tahnoon [Sa'id bin Tahnun] ruler of Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi]. Hennell and Sheikh Sa'id discuss mediations between Bahrain and the Wahhabi tribe, the Maritime Truce, and relations between Abu Dhabi and Kishm [Qeshm]. Hennell also describes a new boat purchased by Sheikh Sa'id, which he suspected has been purchased with the help of Ameer Fysul [Amir Faisal] the Wahhabi Chief.
